reference.title: Examples of bulk import and export
reference.shortdesc: All of the examples in this section are run using the ij utility.

section.title: Example: Importing all data from a file
section.p: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from the myfile.del file. The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

section.title: Example: Importing all data from a delimited file
section.p: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, myfile.del. This example defines the percentage character (%) as the string delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter. The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

section.title: Example: Importing all data from a table, using a separate import file for the LOB data
section.p: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, staff.del. The import file staff.del is the main import file and contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data. This example specifies a comma as the column delimiter. The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

section.title: Example: Importing data into specific columns, using a separate import file for the LOB data
section.p: The following example shows how to import data into several columns of the STAFF table. The STAFF table includes a LOB column in a sample database. The import file, staff.del, is a delimited data file. The staff.del file contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data. The data in the import file is formatted using double quotation marks (") as the string delimiter and a comma (,) as the column delimiter. The data will be appended to the existing data in the STAFF table.

section.title: Example: Exporting all data from a table to a single export file
section.p: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file myfile.del.

section.title: Example: Exporting data from a table to a single delimited export file
section.p: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table to a delimited data file, myfile.del, with the percentage character (%) as the character delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter from the STAFF table.

section.title: Example: Exporting all data from a table, using a separate export file for the LOB data
section.p: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, staff.del, and the LOB export file, pictures.dat.

section.title: Example: Exporting data from a query to a single export file
section.p: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file awards.del.

section.title: Example: Exporting data from a query, using a separate export file for the LOB data
section.p: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, staff.del, and the LOB data to the file pictures.dat.
